meanings.definition: The state or quality of being discontinuous.
meanings.sent1: The discontinuities in the pattern made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the discontinuities in the story to the class.
meanings.sent3: The sudden discontinuities in the music startled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The discontinuities in her argument left everyone confused.
meanings.sent5: The discontinuities in the painting created a sense of chaos.

meanings.definition: A break or interruption in a continuous process.
meanings.sent1: The power outage caused discontinuities in the production line.
meanings.sent2: The discontinuities in the road made the journey longer.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected discontinuities in the movie plot kept viewers engaged.
meanings.sent4: The discontinuities in the conversation made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent5: The discontinuities in the music added suspense to the performance.

meanings.sent1: The discontinuities in his argument made it weak.
meanings.sent2: The discontinuities in the design of the building were evident.
meanings.sent3: The discontinuities in the plan caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent4: The discontinuities in her story left gaps in the narrative.
meanings.sent5: The discontinuities in the fabric pattern made it look mismatched.
